course_title: Topics in Jewish History: Refugees and the Holocaust
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 10 / Seats Avail: 10Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as REL 270 2, HIST 296 1)
This course satisfies the Religion major requirement:- Theme, Region. 
As the world experiences the biggest refugee movement since the end of the Second World War, this course will explore the history of the Holocaust through the lens of forced migration. It will cover Jews' flight from the Third Reich and German-occupied countries, resettlement as an element of Nazi genocidal policies, postwar displacement, and emigration from Europe. Our focus will be on the individual experiences of refugees, as well as the responses from governments and local communities. We will pay special attention to the US reaction. And we will situate our studies within the survey of the global refugee movement in the 20th century, the age of genocide.
